youtube_channel_to_rss package

Submodules

youtube_channel_to_rss.main module

Script converts a YouTube channel URL to RSS feed URL and fetches latest videos from the RSS feed. It allows filtering videos by date or title.

Modules:

requests: To make HTTP requests to fetch YouTube page source code and RSS feed content. bs4 (BeautifulSoup): To parse HTML and XML content. re: To perform regular expression matching. argparse: To handle command-line arguments. datetime: To handle date and time operations. pyperclip: To copy the RSS feed URL to the clipboard.

Functions:

get_youtube_source_code(youtube_url): Fetches the source code of a YouTube page. get_youtube_channel_id(source_code): Extracts the channel ID from the YouTube source code. create_rss_feed_url(channel_id): Creates the RSS feed URL from the channel ID. fetch_rss_feed_content(rss_feed_url, limit=5): Fetches and parses the RSS feed content. filter_videos(entries, filter_by=None, filter_value=None): Filters videos.

Usage:

python main.py <youtube_url> [–filter_by <filter_by>] [–filter_value <filter_value>]

Example

python main.py https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC_x5XG1OV2P6uZZ5FSM9Ttw –filter_by date –filter_value 2023-10-01

youtube_channel_to_rss.main.create_rss_feed_url(cid: str) → str | None[source]

Creates the RSS feed URL from the YouTube channel ID.

Parameters:

cid (str) – The YouTube channel ID.

Returns:

The RSS feed URL if the channel ID is provided, otherwise None.

Return type:

str

youtube_channel_to_rss.main.fetch_rss_feed_content(feed_url: str, limit: int = 5) → ResultSet[PageElement | Tag | NavigableString] | None[source]

Fetches and parses the RSS feed content, limited to the latest videos.

Parameters:

  • feed_url (str) – The URL of the RSS feed.

  • limit (int, optional) – The maximum number of videos to fetch. Defaults to 5.

Returns:

A list of BeautifulSoup ‘entry’ elements representing the videos if successful. None: If there is an error fetching the RSS feed or parsing the content.

Return type:

list

youtube_channel_to_rss.main.filter_videos(param_entries: list[BeautifulSoup], filter_by: str | None = None, filter_value: str | None = None) → list[dict[str, str]][source]

Filters videos by date, title, or other metadata.

Parameters:

  • param_entries (list) – A list of BeautifulSoup ‘entry’ elements representing the videos.

  • filter_by (str, optional) – The criteria to filter videos by (‘date’ or ‘title’).

  • filter_value (str, optional) – The value to filter videos by. Defaults to None.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries containing filtered video details.

Return type:

list

youtube_channel_to_rss.main.get_youtube_channel_id(html_source_code: bytes | None) → str | None[source]

Extracts the channel ID from the YouTube source code.

Parameters:

html_source_code (bytes) – The HTML source code of the YouTube page.

Returns:

The channel ID if found, otherwise None.

Return type:

str

youtube_channel_to_rss.main.get_youtube_source_code(url: str) → bytes | None[source]

Fetches the source code of a YouTube page.

Parameters:

url (str) – The URL of the YouTube page.

Returns:

The content of the YouTube page if the request is successful. None: If there is an error fetching the URL.

Return type:

bytes
